Package test

Class Brick.Crack

Object
Crack
Enclosing class:
Brick
public class Brick.Crack extends Object
Crack class which is only implemented by bricks that crack such as Cement and Graphite.
Author:
KhooChenNan

  • Constructor Details

    • Crack

      public Crack​(int crackDepth, int steps)
      Constructor for the crack class. It takes in 2 parameters crackDepth and steps and then later on set both of the variables into that specific brick's crackDepth and steps.
      Parameters:
      crackDepth - The crack depth of that specific brick.
      steps - The steps of that specific brick.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public GeneralPath draw()
      Draws the cracking line on the bricks if there are any impacts.
      Returns:
      The line "crack" of GeneralPath data type is returned.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the cracking of the brick.

    • makeCrack

      protected void makeCrack​(Point2D point, int direction)
      Makes the crack on the specific brick types. Only Cement and Graphite will be implementing this. For example, if the direction is "left", it will first sets the location of the starting point then the end point, followed by setting the value of a the coordinate "tmp" based on the start and end point. After that, it will make the crack based on the impact and "tmp".
      Parameters:
      point - The coordinates to be set on.
      direction - The direction to be set on. (E.g. Left, right, up, down)

    • makeCrack

      protected void makeCrack​(Point start, Point end)
      Unlike makeCrack() function, this function will not take in any direction and will make the crack based on the 2 input parameters and they are the starting and ending coordinates.
      Parameters:
      start - The starting coordinate
      end - The ending coordinate

    • randomInBounds

      private int randomInBounds​(int bound)
      A function that takes in the inbounds and then returns a calculated value which consists of a randomly generated value up until a certain integer.
      Parameters:
      bound - The inbounds to be passed on for calculation of variable "n".
      Returns:
      An integer of randomly generated value with the range from 0 to "n" minus the inbounds.

    • inMiddle

      private boolean inMiddle​(int i, int steps, int divisions)
      A boolean function that takes in 3 parameters: "i", "steps", and "divisions" and does calculation for variable "low" and "up".
      Parameters:
      i - The number of counts.
      steps - The number of steps.
      divisions - The number of divisions.
      Returns:
      Returns true if "i" is greater than "low" and "i" lesser than up. Else, returns false.

    • jumps

      private int jumps​(int bound, double probability)
      A function that returns 0 if the randomly generated decimal is smaller than the probability of jumping. Else, it calls the function randomInBounds() by passing in the parameter bound, which is the inbounds, and then returns the calculated value.
      Parameters:
      bound - The inbounds.
      probability - The probability of jumping.
      Returns:
      The value "0" is returned if the randomly generated decimal is smaller than the probability of jumping. Else, it returns an integer which is calculated through the function randomInBounds() that takes in the variable "bound".

    • makeRandomPoint

      private Point makeRandomPoint​(Point from, Point to, int direction)
      Makes a random point and takes in 3 parameters: initial coordinates, resulting coordinates, and its direction. If the direction is "horizontal", it sets the variable "out" with a specific coordinates after calculation and it will then be returned. Likewise for the case of vertical direction.
      Parameters:
      from - The initial coordinates (where it is from)
      to - The resulting coordinates (where it is going to)
      direction - The direction of where it is going towards
      Returns:
      Coordinates to be returned due to the resulting direction.
